title: Joe Mellor
text:
Joseph Patrick Mellor (born 28 December 1990) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a or for the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a>. 
He previously played for the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and on loan from <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at <a href="Harlequins%20RL">Harlequins RL</a> in the top flight and the <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> in the <a href="2011%20RFL%20Championship">Championship</a> and the Super League. Mellor later joined <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> on a permanent deal in the Super League. He also played for the <a href="Toronto%20Wolfpack">Toronto Wolfpack</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a> and the <a href="Super%20League">top flight</a>.
Background.
Mellor was born in <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a>, <a href="Cheshire%2C%20England">Cheshire, England</a>.
Club career.
Mellor signed as a professional for Wigan from <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a>-based amateur side <a href="Latchford%2C%20Cheshire">Latchford</a>. In 2009, Mellor was awarded Man-of-the-Match in the Reserve Grand Final following a fantastic performance. An injury-plagued 2010 meant limited appearances in Wigan's junior teams, however, he did play in the Under-20 Cup Final win over St Helens. He made his Super League début in rugby league whilst on loan at <a href="London%20Broncos">Harlequins</a> in 2011's <a href="Super%20League%20XVI">Super League XVI</a>, coming off the bench in a 27-16 win over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in round five.
On his return to Wigan, Mellor was sent on loan to Widnes along with <a href="Dom%20Crosby">Dom Crosby</a> and <a href="Logan%20Tomkins">Logan Tomkins</a>. Mellor featured at stand-off for the Chemics, scoring tries in the home fixtures against <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> and <a href="Toulouse%20Olympique">Toulouse Olympique</a>, and a brace away at Barrow.
Mellor was once again loaned to Widnes in 2012, and joined the club on a permanent contract after being released by Wigan at the end of 2012. Since permanently joining Widnes, Mellor improved over his years at the club, being regarded as one of the best players in Super League.
After the departure of captain <a href="Kevin%20Brown%20%28English%20rugby%20league%29">Kevin Brown</a> to the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> at the end of 2016, Mellor was handed co-captaincy alongside <a href="Chris%20Houston%20%28rugby%20league%29">Chris Houston</a>, and has been given the number 6 jersey.
On 10 November 2020, it was announced that Mellor would join <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> for the <a href="2021%20Super%20League%20season">2021 Super League season</a>.
